  <title>Supertropical Quadratic Forms II</title>
  <toctitle>Supertropical Quadratic Forms II</toctitle>
  <creator role="author">
    <personname>Zur Izhakian</personname>
    <contact role="address">Institute of Mathematics,
University of Aberdeen, AB24 3UE,
Aberdeen, UK.</contact>

  </creator>
  <creator before=", " role="author">
    <personname>Manfred Knebusch</personname>
<!--  %**** String Line 100 **** -->    <contact role="address">Department of Mathematics,
NWF-I Mathematik, Universität Regensburg 93040 Regensburg,
Germany</contact>

  </creator>
  <creator before=" and " role="author">
    <personname>Louis Rowen</personname>
    <contact role="address">Department of Mathematics,
Bar-Ilan University, Ramat-Gan 52900, Israel</contact>

  </creator>
  <date name="Date:" role="creation">November 30, 2018</date>
  <abstract name="Abstract.">
    <p>This article is a sequel of <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, where we introduced quadratic forms on a module  <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="m1">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> over a supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="m2">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> and analysed the set of bilinear companions of a quadratic form <Math mode="inline" tex="q:V\to R" text="q colon V to R" xml:id="m3">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> in case that the module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="m4">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is free, with fairly complete results if  <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="m5">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> is a supersemifield. Given such a companion <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="m6">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> we now classify the pairs of vectors in <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="m7">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> in terms of <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,b)." text="open-interval@(q, b)" xml:id="m8">
        <XMath>
          <XMDual>
            <XMRef idref="m8.3"/>
            <XMWrap>
              <XMDual xml:id="m8.3">
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="m8.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="m8.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m8.1">q</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m8.2">b</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
          </XMDual>
        </XMath>
      </Math> This amounts to a kind of tropical trigonometry with a sharp distinction between the cases that a sort of Cauchy-Schwarz
inequality holds or fails. We apply this to study the supertropicalizations (cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>) of a quadratic form on a free module <Math mode="inline" tex="X" text="X" xml:id="m9">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">X</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> over a field in the simplest cases of interest where <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{rk}}(X)=2" text="rk@(X) = 2" xml:id="m10">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMRef idref="m10.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="m10.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="m10.1">rk</XMTok>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m10.2">X</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math>.</p>
    <p>In the last part of the paper we start exploiting the fact that the free module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="m11">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> as above has a unique base up to permutations and multiplication by units of <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="m12">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, and moreover <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="m13">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> carries a so called minimal (partial) ordering. Under mild restriction on <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="m14">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math> we determine all <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="m15">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>-minimal vectors in <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="m16">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>, i.e., the vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in V" text="x element-of V" xml:id="m17">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> for which <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x^{\prime})&lt;q(x)" text="q * x ^ prime less q * x" xml:id="m18">
        <XMath>
          <XMApp>
            <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="m18.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="m18.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="m18.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="m18.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMApp>
        </XMath>
      </Math> whenever <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime}&lt;x." text="x ^ prime less x" xml:id="m19">
        <XMath>
          <XMDual>
            <XMRef idref="m19.1"/>
            <XMWrap>
              <XMApp xml:id="m19.1">
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
          </XMDual>
        </XMath>
      </Math></p>
  </abstract>
  <keywords name="Key words and phrases">Tropical algebra, supertropical modules, bilinear forms,
quadratic forms, quadratic pairs, supertropicalization.</keywords>
  <classification name="2010 Mathematics Subject Classification" scheme="2010 Mathematics Subject Classification">Primary 15A03, 15A09, 15A15, 16Y60; Secondary
14T05, 15A33, 20M18, 51M20</classification>

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p2">
      <p>The present paper is devoted to a study of quadratic forms and
pairs on <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-modules with <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a “supertropical” semiring,
often more specifically a “supersemifield”. It is a sequel to the paper
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> by the same authors.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p3">
      <p>We recall (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 0.3]</cite> and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="IKR1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, §3]</cite>), that a semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
<!--  %**** String Line 150 **** -->called <text font="bold">supertropical</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="e:=1_{R}+1_{R}" text="e assign 1 _ R + 1 _ R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is an idempotent
(i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="2\times 1=4\times 1)" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
            <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and the following axioms hold for
all  <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in R:" text="list@(x, y) element-of R colon absent" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m4.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m4.2">y</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
      <equationgroup class="ltx_eqn_align" xml:id="A0.EGx1">

      </equationgroup>
      <p>Then the ideal <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a semiring with unit element <Math mode="inline" tex="e," text="e" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m7.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m7.1">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
which is <text font="bold">bipotent</text>, i.e., for any <Math mode="inline" tex="u,v\in eR" text="list@(u, v) element-of e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m8.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m8.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m8.1">u</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m8.2">v</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the sum <Math mode="inline" tex="u+v" text="u + v" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
is either <Math mode="inline" tex="u" text="u" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="v." text="v" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m11.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m11.1">v</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> It follows that <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> carries a total
ordering, compatible with addition and multiplication, which is
given by</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:0.5" xml:id="Sx1.E5">
        <tags>
          <tag>(0.5)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">0.5</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="u\leq v{\ {\Leftrightarrow}\ }u+v=v." text="u less= v Leftrightarrow u + v = v" xml:id="Sx1.E5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.E5.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.E5.m1.1">
                  <XMTok name="Leftrightarrow" role="METARELOP" rpadding="5.0pt">⇔</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="5.0pt">v</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">u</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>The addition in a supertropical semiring is determined by the map
<Math mode="inline" tex="x\mapsto ex" text="x maps-to e * x" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and the total ordering on <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as follows: If
<Math mode="inline" tex="x,y\in R," text="list@(x, y) element-of R" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m15.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p3.m15.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m15.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p3.m15.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m15.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m15.2">y</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> then</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:0.6" xml:id="Sx1.E6">
        <tags>
          <tag>(0.6)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">0.6</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="x+y=\begin{cases}y&amp;\ \text{if}\ ex&lt;ey,\\&#10;x&amp;\ \text{if}\ ex&gt;ey,\\&#10;ey&amp;\ \text{if}\ ex=ey.\end{cases}" text="x + y = cases@(y, [if] * e * x less e * y, x, [if] * e * x &gt; e * y, e * y, [if] * e * x = e * y)" xml:id="Sx1.E6.m1">

      <p>In particular (taking <Math mode="inline" tex="y=0" text="y = 0" xml:id="Sx1.p3.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:0.6"/>) or in (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:0.4"/>))
<!--  %**** String Line 175 **** --></p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:0.7" xml:id="Sx1.E7">
        <tags>
          <tag>(0.7)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">0.7</tag>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                  <XMTok name="Rightarrow" role="ARROW" rpadding="5.0pt">⇒</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>

    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p4">
      <p>For the convenience of the reader, we give more terminology. In a
supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R," text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the elements of the set
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}(R):=R{\setminus}(eR)" text="T * R assign R set-minus e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m2.1">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m2.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p4.m2.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are called <text font="bold">tangible</text>, while those of
the set <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}(R):=(eR){\setminus}\{0\}" text="G * R assign e * R set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m3.1">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m3.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p4.m3.3">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m3.2">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are called
<text font="bold">ghost</text> elements. The zero of <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is regarded both as
tangible and ghost. The semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> itself is called <text font="bold">tangible</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
generated by <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}(R)" text="T * R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m7.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m7.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as a semiring. Clearly, this happens iff
<Math mode="inline" tex="e{\mathcal{T}}(R)={\mathcal{G}}(R)." text="e * T * R = G * R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m8.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p4.m8.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m8.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m8.1">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m8.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m8.2">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> If <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}(R)\neq\emptyset," text="T * R not-equals empty-set" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m9.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p4.m9.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p4.m9.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m9.1">R</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="empty-set" name="emptyset" role="ID">∅</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> then the set</p>
      <equation xml:id="Sx1.Ex1">
        <Math mode="display" tex="R^{\prime}:={\mathcal{T}}(R)\cup e{\mathcal{T}}(R)\cup\{0\}" text="R ^ prime assign T * R union e * T * R union set@(0)" xml:id="Sx1.Ex1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>

              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>

                <XMApp>

                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                <XMDual>

                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.Ex1.m1.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                    <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="Sx1.Ex1.m1.3">0</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>is the largest subsemiring of <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p4.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> which is tangible supertropical.
{We have discarded the “superfluous” ghost elements.}</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p5">
      <p>In the paper <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>, the main thrust is the study of the set of
all companions of a given quadratic form <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on a free module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
over a supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R." text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p5.m3.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m3.1">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> After fixing a base
<Math mode="inline" tex="(\varepsilon_{i}\|i\in I)" text="conditional@(varepsilon _ i, i) element-of I" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p5.m4.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p5.m4.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="||" role="MODIFIEROP">∥</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, this set can be described by use
of a “companion matrix” (<Math mode="inline" tex="C_{i,j}(q))" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">C</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p5.m6.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p5.m6.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m6.1">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m6.2">j</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
            <XMWrap>
              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m6.3">q</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, cf.  <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §6]</cite>. For
<Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p5.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a tangible semifield, complete results can be found in
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §7]</cite>. Explicitly, these hard results are needed in the
present paper only in the proof of the initial key Theorem
<ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.5.5"/>, which for a first reading may be taken on
<!--  %**** String Line 200 **** -->faith.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p6">
      <p>The quadratic form <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called <text font="bold">rigid</text>, if <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has only one
companion. This happens iff <Math mode="inline" tex="q({\varepsilon}_{i})=0" text="q * varepsilon _ i = 0" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p6.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p6.m3.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for all vectors
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\varepsilon}_{i}" text="varepsilon _ i" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of the fixed base <Math mode="inline" tex="({\varepsilon}_{i}\|i\in I)," text="conditional@(varepsilon _ i, i) element-of I" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p6.m5.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="Sx1.p6.m5.1">
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p6.m5.1.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p6.m5.1.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="||" role="MODIFIEROP">∥</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> cf.
<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 3.5]</cite>. <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is called <text font="bold">quasilinear</text> if the
bilinear form <Math mode="inline" tex="b=0" text="b = 0" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a companion of <Math mode="inline" tex="q," text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p6.m8.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m8.1">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> i.e.,
<Math mode="inline" tex="q(x+y)=q(x)+q(y)" text="q * (x + y) = q * x + q * y" xml:id="Sx1.p6.m9">
          <XMath>

    <para xml:id="Sx1.p7">
      <p>Any quadratic form <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on a free <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-module can be written as a
sum</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:0.9" xml:id="Sx1.E9">
        <tags>
          <tag>(0.9)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">0.9</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="q=q_{QL}+\rho," text="q = q _ (Q * L) + rho" xml:id="Sx1.E9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.E9.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.E9.m1.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>where <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{QL}" text="q _ (Q * L)" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">Q</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a quasilinear (and uniquely determined by <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>)
and <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is rigid (but not unique), cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §4]</cite>. We call
<Math mode="inline" tex="q_{\operatorname{QL}}" text="q _ QL" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">QL</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> the <text font="bold">quasilinear part</text> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\rho" text="rho" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="rho" role="UNKNOWN">ρ</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a
<text font="bold">rigid complement</text> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q_{\operatorname{QL}}" text="q _ QL" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post">QL</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="q." text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p7.m10.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p7.m10.1">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
    </para>
<!--  %**** String Line 225 **** -->    <para xml:id="Sx1.p8">
      <p>The present paper is divided as follows. The first three sections
are devoted to a study of pairs of non-zero vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m1">
          <XMath>

              <XMWrap>

                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in an
<Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> equipped with a quadratic pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,b)," text="open-interval@(q, b)" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m4.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="Sx1.p8.m4.3">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m4.1">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m4.2">b</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> mostly for
<Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a tangible semifield. Sometimes we only assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a
(bipotent) semifield. We face an all important dichotomy. Either
<Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m7.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m7.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m7.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m7.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is <text font="italic">excessive</text> (cf. Definition <ref labelref="LABEL:defn:II.5.6"/>
below) or the restriction <Math mode="inline" tex="q|Rx+Ry" text="conditional@(q, R * x + R * y)" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="conditional" role="MODIFIEROP" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasilinear. In the
latter case, we also say that the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m10.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p8.m10.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m10.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m10.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <text font="bold">quasilinear</text>
(with respect to <Math mode="inline" tex="q)" xml:id="Sx1.p8.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p9">
      <p>An intriguing point here is that this dichotomy does not depend on
the choice of the companion <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="Sx1.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q," text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p9.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p9.m2.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p9.m2.1">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> although <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="Sx1.p9.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is used in
the definition of excessiveness (cf. Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:cor:II.5.7"/>).</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p10">
      <p>In Section <ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.6"/>, we delve into a kind of “<text font="italic">tropical
trigonometry</text>”. If <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are anisotropic, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x)\neq 0," text="q * x not-equals 0" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m3.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p10.m3.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m3.1">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
<Math mode="inline" tex="q(y)\neq 0," text="q * y not-equals 0" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m4.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p10.m4.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m4.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m4.1">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we define a CS-ratio<note mark="1" role="footnote" xml:id="footnote1"><tags>
            <tag>1</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">footnote 1</tag>
          </tags>“CS” is an acronym of
“Cauchy-Schwarz”.</note></p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:0.10" xml:id="Sx1.E10">
        <tags>
          <tag>(0.10)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">0.10</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x,y):=\frac{eb(x,y)^{2}}{eq(x)q(y)}\in eR," text="CS@(x, y) assign (e * b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2) / (e * q * x * q * y) element-of e * R" xml:id="Sx1.E10.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.E10.m1.8"/>

                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>

                    <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>

                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>

                      <XMApp>

                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="Sx1.E10.m1.1"/>

                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.E10.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="Sx1.E10.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.E10.m1.3">x</XMTok>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="Sx1.E10.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.E10.m1.4">y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>which makes sense since <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a semifield.
When the set <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is densely ordered, then <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m7.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m7.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m7.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m7.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is excessive
iff <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x,y)&gt;e." text="CS@(x, y) &gt; e" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m8.2"/>

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m8.1">CS</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m8.2">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m8.3">y</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> When <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is discrete, the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is

          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
excessive if <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x)" text="q * x" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m17.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m17.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="q(y)" text="q * y" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m18.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m18.1">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is tangible, while <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m19.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m19.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m19.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m19.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
quasilinear if both <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x)" text="q * x" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m20.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m20.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="q(y)" text="q * y" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p10.m21.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p10.m21.1">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are ghost (cf. Theorems
<ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.5.5"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.5.12"/>). It seems to us that
this still somewhat mysterious fact bears relevance for problems
of an arithmetical nature in quadratic form theory, even over
fields.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p11">
      <p>For any anisotropic vector <Math mode="inline" tex="w" text="w" xml:id="Sx1.p11.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">w</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, the function <Math mode="inline" tex="x\mapsto{\operatorname{CS}}(x,w)" text="x maps-to CS@(x, w)" xml:id="Sx1.p11.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="maps-to" name="mapsto" role="ARROW">↦</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p11.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p11.m2.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p11.m2.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="Sx1.p11.m2.1">CS</XMTok>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p11.m2.2">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p11.m2.3">w</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMApp>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is subadditive, cf. Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.6.10"/>. This fact
has turned out to be of central importance in a (still incomplete)
sequel <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF3" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite> of the present paper.</p>
    </para>

This completes our account of tropical trigonometry in the present
paper. First applications show up in the later sections, but a
more adequate language of “rays”,<note mark="2" role="footnote" xml:id="footnote2"><tags>
            <tag>2</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">footnote 2</tag>
          </tags>The ray of a vector
<Math mode="inline" tex="x\in V{\setminus}\{0\}" text="x element-of V set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="footnote2.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="footnote2.m1.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="footnote2.m1.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is the set of all <Math mode="inline" tex="y\in V" text="y element-of V" xml:id="footnote2.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}x=\mu y" text="lambda * x = mu * y" xml:id="footnote2.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for some <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda},\mu\in R{\setminus}\{0\}." text="list@(lambda, mu) element-of R set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="footnote2.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="footnote2.m4.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="footnote2.m4.4">
                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="footnote2.m4.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="footnote2.m4.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="footnote2.m4.2">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="footnote2.m4.3">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>

                        <XMApp>

                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="footnote2.m4.1">0</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math></note> to use this
trigonometry conveniently, has to wait for the paper <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF3" separator="," yyseparator=","/>]</cite>
due to lack of space here.
