    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p13">
      <p>Sections §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.8"/>–§<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:7"/> of the paper are based on
the following two facts for <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p13.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-modules, valid over any
supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R:" text="R colon absent" xml:id="Sx1.p13.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
      <enumerate xml:id="Sx1.I1">
        <item xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1">
          <tags>
            <tag>1)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 1)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">The Unique Base Theorem</text>, cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorem 0.9]</cite>:
Given a base <Math mode="inline" tex="({\varepsilon}_{i}\|i\in I)" text="conditional@(varepsilon _ i, i) element-of I" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m1.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="conditional" name="||" role="MODIFIEROP">∥</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> of a free <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-module <Math mode="inline" tex="V," text="V" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m3.1">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> we
obtain any other base of <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> by permuting the <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varepsilon}_{i}" text="varepsilon _ i" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and
multiplying them by units of <Math mode="inline" tex="R." text="R" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m6.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix1.p1.m6.1">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math></p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2">
          <tags>
            <tag>2)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item 2)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1">
            <p><text font="italic">Existence of minimal orderings</text>, cf.
§<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:I.6"/> below. Every <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> carries a partial
ordering, called the <text font="bold">minimal ordering</text> on <Math mode="inline" tex="V," text="V" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m3.1">V</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> which is
defined as follows:</p>
            <equation xml:id="Sx1.Ex2">
              <Math mode="display" tex="x\leq y{\ {\Leftrightarrow}\ }\exists z\in V:x+z=y." text="(x less= y) Leftrightarrow (exists@(z) element-of V) colon (x + z = y)" xml:id="Sx1.Ex2.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="Sx1.Ex2.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.Ex2.m1.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" rpadding="5.0pt">y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="Leftrightarrow" role="METARELOP" rpadding="5.0pt">⇔</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="exists" role="BIGOP">∃</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
            </equation>
            <p>In particular, <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> itself has a minimal ordering. The minimal
ordering on <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is compatible with addition and scalar
multiplication. Basics about the minimal ordering on <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and then
on a free <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.I1.ix2.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-module are provided in §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:I.6"/>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p14">
      <p>The Unique Base Theorem is the source of our motivation for
introducing supertropicalizations of a quadratic form <Math mode="inline" tex="q:V\to R" text="q colon V to R" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
on a free module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> over a ring <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by a so-called
<text font="italic">supervaluation</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi:R\to U" text="varphi colon R to U" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN">φ</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with values in a
<!--  %**** String Line 300 **** -->supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §9]</cite>. Given a base
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{L}}=({\varepsilon}_{i}\|i\in I)" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>

              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

              </XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="parallel-to" name="||" role="VERTBAR">∥</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
            </XMWrap>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, we obtained a

                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on the standard free
<Math mode="inline" tex="U" text="U" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-module <Math mode="inline" tex="U^{(I)}" text="U ^ I" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">U</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p14.m10.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m10.1">I</XMTok>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> by this process [loc. cit.], which in some
sense measures <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{L}}" text="L" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in terms of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\varphi." text="varphi" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p14.m13.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="varphi" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m13.1">φ</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> In
§<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.8"/> of the present paper, we study how <Math mode="inline" tex="\tilde{q}" text="tilde@(q)" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> varies
with a change of the base <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{L}}" text="L" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">L</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the simplest cases of
interest, where <Math mode="inline" tex="I=\{1,2\}." text="I = set@(1, 2)" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p14.m16.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p14.m16.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p14.m16.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.p14.m16.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="Sx1.p14.m16.2">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p15">
      <p>Given a quadratic form <Math mode="inline" tex="q:V\to R" text="q colon V to R" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> on a module <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> over a
supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R," text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="Sx1.p15.m3.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m3.1">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> we call a vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in V" text="x element-of V" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
<Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-<text font="bold">minimal</text>, if <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x^{\prime})&lt;q(x)" text="q * x ^ prime less q * x" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p15.m6.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.p15.m6.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p15.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m6.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for every vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime}&lt;x" text="x ^ prime less x" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (with
respect to the minimal ordering of <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="R)" xml:id="Sx1.p15.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>.<note mark="3" role="footnote" xml:id="footnote3"><tags>
            <tag>3</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">3</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">footnote 3</tag>
          </tags>As
usual, <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime}&lt;x" text="x ^ prime less x" xml:id="footnote3.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> means <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime}\leq x" text="x ^ prime less= x" xml:id="footnote3.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime}\neq x." text="x ^ prime not-equals x" xml:id="footnote3.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="footnote3.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="footnote3.m3.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math></note></p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p16">
      <p>In the last sections §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.9"/> and §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:7"/>, we obtain a
detailed description of all minimal vectors and certain relations between
them in the case that <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p16.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is free and <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p16.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is tangible
supertropical with <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}(R)" text="G * R" xml:id="Sx1.p16.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="Sx1.p16.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p16.m3.1">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a cancellative monoid under
multiplication (in particular, if <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="Sx1.p16.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a tangible
supersemifield).</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="Sx1.p17">
      <p>Every <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x\in V" text="x element-of V" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is trapped in a smallest submodule <Math mode="inline" tex="V_{J}=\sum_{i\in J}Rv_{i}" text="V _ J = (sum _ (i element-of J))@(R * v _ i)" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="post">∑</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">v</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="|J|\leq 4" text="absolute-value@(J) less= 4" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p17.m5.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m5.1">J</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and thus it suffices to study <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal vectors in a given free module of rank at most <Math mode="inline" tex="4" text="4" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. In §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.9"/> we easily find all <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal vectors for <Math mode="inline" tex="|J|\leq 2" text="absolute-value@(J) less= 2" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p17.m9.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m9.1">J</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> (vectors of “small support”). Then in
§<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:7"/> we prove that for <Math mode="inline" tex="|J|=3" text="absolute-value@(J) = 3" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p17.m10.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m10.1">J</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="|J|=4" text="absolute-value@(J) = 4" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.p17.m11.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m11.1">J</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="VERTBAR" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> a <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is the maximum <Math mode="inline" tex="y\vee z" text="y or z" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m14">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="or" name="vee" role="ADDOP">∨</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of a pair of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m15">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimals <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m16">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="z" text="z" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m17">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of small support which is uniquely determined by <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m18">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, except in one case, where <Math mode="inline" tex="y" text="y" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m19">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="z" text="z" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m20">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> can be freely chosen in a triplet <Math mode="inline" tex="y_{1},y_{2},y_{3}" text="list@(y _ 1, y _ 2, y _ 3)" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m21">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

                <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>

                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

                </XMApp>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m22">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimals of small support, uniquely determined by <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m23">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>. Conversely, we find out which maxima <Math mode="inline" tex="y\vee z" text="y or z" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m24">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="or" name="vee" role="ADDOP">∨</XMTok>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m25">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimals <Math mode="inline" tex="y,z" text="list@(y, z)" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m26">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with small support are again <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="Sx1.p17.m27">
          <XMath>

          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal.</p>

<!--  %**** String Line 325 **** -->    <para xml:id="Sx1.p18">
      <p>The arguments in §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.9"/> and §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:7"/> may look massy due to the many case distinctions needed, but the give a good illustration of the, as we feel, beautiful combinatorics at hands in any supertropical quadratic space.</p>

                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>

                          <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="absent"/>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"></text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5">
            <tags>
              <tag><Math mode="inline" tex="\bullet" text="bullet" xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok name="bullet" role="MULOP">∙</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item <Math mode="inline" tex="\bullet" text="bullet" xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok name="bullet" role="MULOP">∙</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math></tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="\nu_{R}" text="nu _ R" xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> denotes the ghost map </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\to eR," text="absent to e * R" xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1.m2.1">

                          <XMApp>

                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> </text><Math mode="inline" tex="a\mapsto ea." text="a maps-to e * a" xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>

                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.I2.ix5.p1.m3.1">

                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"></text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
        <p><text font="italic">When there is no ambiguity, we write <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}," text="T" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m2.1">T</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}," text="G" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m3.1">G</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
<Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> instead of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}(R)," text="T * R" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m5.2"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m5.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m5.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m5.1">R</XMTok>

                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>

                      <XMApp>

                </XMDual>

                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="a{\cong_{\nu}}b" text="a approximately-equals _ nu b" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">a</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> (“<Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-equivalent”) means that <Math mode="inline" tex="ea=eb" text="e * a = e * b" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, while <Math mode="inline" tex="a&lt;_{\nu}b" text="a less _ nu b" xml:id="Sx1.Thmthm1.p2.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

              </XMath>

              <XMath>
                <XMApp>

                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>

              <tag role="typerefnum">item  b)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S1.I1.ix7.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">A </text><text font="bold italic">supertropical quadratic space</text><text font="italic"> is a quadratic module
over a tangible supersemifield.</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p1">
      <p>We intend to study pairs of vectors in a supertropical quadratic
space. Preparing for this we slightly extend the notion of “partial” rigidity
developed in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §3]</cite> (cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 3.1]</cite>). This makes
sense over any supertropical semiring <Math mode="inline" tex="R." text="R" xml:id="S1.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.p1.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p1.m1.1">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math></p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_defn" inlist="thm theorem:defn" labels="LABEL:defn:II.5.2" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2">
      <tags>
        <tag>Definition 2</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">2</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 2</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 2</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="(V,q)" text="open-interval@(V, q)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m1.1">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m1.2">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a quadratic module over a supertropical semiring
<Math mode="inline" tex="R." text="R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m2.1">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> We say that <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-<text font="bold">rigid at a point</text> <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm2.p1.m5">

        <Math mode="display" tex="\chi:=\chi_{x,y}:R{\varepsilon}_{1}+R{\varepsilon}_{2}\to V" text="chi assign chi _ (list@(x, y)) colon R * varepsilon _ 1 + R * varepsilon _ 2 to V" xml:id="S1.E2.m1">

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> then </text><Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m5">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">-rigid at </text><Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)." text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMDual xml:id="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6.3">
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6.1">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.I2.ix10.p1.m6.2">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"></text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.p4">
        <p>Claim i) follows directly from the definition of a
companion in <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §1]</cite> (<cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 1.14]</cite>).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.p5">
        <p>Claims ii) and iii) are immediate consequences of i).∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S1.p6">
      <p>Concerning quasilinearity, we have a stronger statement.</p>
    </para>

      <para xml:id="S1.p9">

                      <XMRef idref="S1.p9.m1.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.p9.m1.3">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>, and (iii) means that</p>
        <equation xml:id="S1.Ex1">
          <Math mode="display" tex="{\tilde{q}}({\lambda}{\varepsilon}_{1}+\mu{\varepsilon}_{2})={\tilde{q}}({%&#10;\lambda}{\varepsilon}_{1})+{\tilde{q}}(\mu{\varepsilon}_{2})" text="tilde@(q) * (lambda * varepsilon _ 1 + mu * varepsilon _ 2) = tilde@(q) * lambda * varepsilon _ 1 + tilde@(q) * mu * varepsilon _ 2" xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="tilde" role="OVERACCENT" stretchy="false">~</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Ex1.m1.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.Ex1.m1.3">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>for all <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda},\mu\in R" text="list@(lambda, mu) element-of R" xml:id="S1.p9.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p9.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p9.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p9.m2.1">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p9.m2.2">μ</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (cf. <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Definition 2.3]</cite>). Thus clearly (i)
<Math mode="inline" tex="\Leftrightarrow" text="Leftrightarrow" xml:id="S1.p9.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok name="Leftrightarrow" role="METARELOP">⇔</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> (iii).</p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.p10">
        <p>We conclude that all four conditions (i) – (iv) are
equivalent.∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S1.p11">
      <p>We are ready for a key theorem of the paper, emanating from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>,  §7]</cite>.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm:II.5.5" xml:id="S1.Thmthm5">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 5</tag>

      </tags>

      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm5.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a nontrivial tangible supersemifield and <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,b)" text="open-interval@(q, b)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m2.2"/>

                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m2.2">b</XMTok>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a quadratic

                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMath>

                <XMDual>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> Let <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m5">

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be a pair of vectors in
<Math mode="inline" tex="V." text="V" xml:id="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm5.p1.m6.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> We adhere to <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Terminology 7.7]</cite>.</text></p>
        <enumerate xml:id="S1.I4">

          <item xml:id="S1.I4.ix12">
            <tags>
              <tag>b)</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item b)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">Assume that </text><Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is discrete with </text><Math mode="inline" tex="\pi" text="pi" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> a prime element of
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">.</text></p>
            </para>
            <para xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2">
              <p><text font="italic">Now </text><Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is quasilinear on </text><Math mode="inline" tex="Rx+Ry" text="R * x + R * y" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>

                      </XMApp>

                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> if either</text></p>
              <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.5.6" xml:id="S1.E6">
                <tags>
                  <tag>(1.6)</tag>
                  <tag role="refnum">1.6</tag>

                <Math mode="display" tex="b(x,y)^{2}&lt;_{\nu}\pi^{-1}q(x)q(y)" text="b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2 less _ nu pi ^ (- 1) * q * x * q * y" xml:id="S1.E6.m1">

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMApp>

                          <XMDual>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.E6.m1.3"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.E6.m1.4"/>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E6.m1.4">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
              </equation>
              <p><text font="italic">or both values
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="q(x),q(y)" text="list@(q * x, q * y)" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.3"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.4"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.3">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.1">x</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.4">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.2"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p2.m3.2">y</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> are ghost and</text></p>
              <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.5.7" xml:id="S1.E7">
                <tags>
                  <tag>(1.7)</tag>

                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
              </equation>
            </para>
            <para xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p3">
              <p><text font="italic">Otherwise </text><Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.I4.ix12.p3.m1">

      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.p12">
        <p>By Propositions <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.5.3"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.5.4"/> above it
suffices to prove these claims in the special case that <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S1.p12.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is
free with base <Math mode="inline" tex="{\varepsilon}_{1},{\varepsilon}_{2}" text="list@(varepsilon _ 1, varepsilon _ 2)" xml:id="S1.p12.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m2.1">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m2.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and
<Math mode="inline" tex="x={\varepsilon}_{1}," text="x = varepsilon _ 1" xml:id="S1.p12.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m3.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="y={\varepsilon}_{2}." text="y = varepsilon _ 2" xml:id="S1.p12.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p12.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p12.m4.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> Now the results can be read
off from <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Proposition 7.9]</cite> and <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Theorems 7.11 and 7.12]</cite>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S1.p13">
      <p>In order to obtain a better grasp on the contents of this theorem,
we introduce more terminology. <text font="italic">As before <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.p13.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is a nontrivial tangible
supersemifield</text>.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_defn" inlist="thm theorem:defn" labels="LABEL:defn:II.5.6" xml:id="S1.Thmthm6">

      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm6.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,b)" text="open-interval@(q, b)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm6.p1.m1">

        <enumerate xml:id="S1.I5">
          <item xml:id="S1.I5.ix13">
            <tags>

            <para xml:id="S1.I5.ix13.p1">

              <equation xml:id="S1.Ex2">
                <Math mode="display" tex="b(x,y)^{2}&gt;_{\nu}q(x)q(y)." text="b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2 &gt; _ nu q * x * q * y" xml:id="S1.Ex2.m1">

                              <XMDual>
                                <XMApp>

                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>

                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S1.Ex2.m1.4"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Ex2.m1.4">y</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math>
              </equation>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S1.I5.ix14">
            <tags>
              <tag>b)</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item b)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S1.I5.ix14.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">If </text><Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.I5.ix14.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is discrete, then either</text></p>
              <equation xml:id="S1.Ex3">
                <Math mode="display" tex="b(x,y)^{2}&gt;_{\nu}\pi^{-1}q(x)q(y)," text="b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2 &gt; _ nu pi ^ (- 1) * q * x * q * y" xml:id="S1.Ex3.m1">
                  <XMath>

              </equation>

    <para xml:id="S1.p14">
      <p>Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.5.5"/>, up to the rigidity statements there, can be
reformulated as follows.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_cor" inlist="thm theorem:cor" labels="LABEL:cor:II.5.7" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7">
      <tags>
        <tag>Corollary 7</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Corollary 7</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Corollary 7</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">A pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)\in V\times V" text="open-interval@(x, y) element-of V * V" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m1">

                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>

                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is excessive with respect to <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,b)" text="open-interval@(q, b)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
iff <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is <text font="bold">not</text> quasilinear on <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx+Ry." text="R * x + R * y" xml:id="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm7.p1.m4.1"/>

                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>

                    </XMApp>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p15">
      <p>An intriguing point here is that the property “excessive”
depends only on <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y,q." text="list@(x, y, q)" xml:id="S1.p15.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m1.4"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMDual xml:id="S1.p15.m1.4">
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m1.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m1.3"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p15.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p15.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p15.m1.3">q</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> The choice of the companion <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="S1.p15.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> has no
influence, but, of course, is relevant for deciding by computation
whether <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.p15.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m3.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p15.m3.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p15.m3.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p15.m3.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is excessive or not.</p>
    </para>

      <p>We state an easy consequence of Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:cor:II.5.7"/>.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_prop" inlist="thm theorem:prop" labels="LABEL:prop:II.5.8" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8">

      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m1">
