                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> be pairs of vectors in a quadratic space
<Math mode="inline" tex="(V,q)" text="open-interval@(V, q)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m3.1">V</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m3.2">q</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> over a tangible supersemifield. Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="open-interval@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m4.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m4.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m4.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m4.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is
excessive and <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx^{\prime}+Ry^{\prime}\subset Rx+Ry." text="R * x ^ prime + R * y ^ prime subset-of R * x + R * y" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m5.1">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="subset-of" name="subset" role="RELOP">⊂</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> Then <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m6.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m6.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m6.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm8.p1.m6.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is excessive.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.p17">
        <p>Otherwise <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.p17.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> would be quasilinear on <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx+Ry." text="R * x + R * y" xml:id="S1.p17.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p17.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p17.m2.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> But
this implies that <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.p17.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is quasilinear on <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx^{\prime}+Ry^{\prime}," text="R * x ^ prime + R * y ^ prime" xml:id="S1.p17.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p17.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p17.m4.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> a
contradiction.∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S1.p18">
      <p>We now relax the assumption that <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.p18.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a tangible supersemifield and demonstrate that several results obtained so far in the section remain valid in greater generality.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_convention" inlist="thm theorem:convention" labels="LABEL:conv:II.5.9" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9">
      <tags>
        <tag>Convention 9</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">9</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Convention 9</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Convention 9</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">We only assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a supertropical semiring and <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a semifield, i.e., every element of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}=eR{\setminus}\{0\}" text="G = e * R set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m3.1"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is invertible in <Math mode="inline" tex="eR;" text="e * R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m4.1">
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">;</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> hence <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a totaly ordered group. Moreover we assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="eR" text="e * R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is “nontrivial”, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}\neq\{e\}" text="G not-equals set@(e)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m7.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m7.1">e</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. We do not assume anything about <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}:=R{\setminus}eR." text="T assign R set-minus e * R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m8">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m8.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m8.1">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> (<Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{T}}" text="T" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> may even be empty.) We call <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> <text font="bold">discrete</text>, if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m11">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> contains a smallest element <Math mode="inline" tex="c&gt;e" text="c &gt; e" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m12">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, which we denote by <Math mode="inline" tex="c_{0}." text="c _ 0" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m13">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m13.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m13.1">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> (If <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a tangible supersemifield then <Math mode="inline" tex="c_{0}=e\pi^{-1}" text="c _ 0 = e * pi ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m15">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">e</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="pi" role="UNKNOWN">π</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in
the setting <cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite">[<bibref bibrefs="QF1" separator="," yyseparator=","/>, Terminology 7.7]</cite>.)
Otherwise we call <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S1.Thmthm9.p1.m16">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> <text font="bold">dense</text>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p19">
      <p>Assume in the following that <Math mode="inline" tex="(q,b)" text="open-interval@(q, b)" xml:id="S1.p19.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p19.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p19.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p19.m1.1">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p19.m1.2">b</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a quadratic pair on the <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S1.p19.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-module <Math mode="inline" tex="V." text="V" xml:id="S1.p19.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S1.p19.m3.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p19.m3.1">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
For the sake of brevity we call a pair <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y" text="list@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.p19.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p19.m4.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p19.m4.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p19.m4.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p19.m4.2">y</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of vectors in <Math mode="inline" tex="V{\setminus}\{0\}" text="V set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="S1.p19.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p19.m5.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S1.p19.m5.1">0</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <text font="bold">quasilinear</text> if <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.p19.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasilinear on
<Math mode="inline" tex="Rx\times Ry" text="R * x * R * y" xml:id="S1.p19.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, equivalently if the restriction <Math mode="inline" tex="q|Rx\times Ry" text="conditional@(q, R * x * R * y)" xml:id="S1.p19.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="conditional" role="MODIFIEROP" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">×</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S1.p19.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasilinear.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_defn" inlist="thm theorem:defn" labels="LABEL:def:II.5.10" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10">
      <tags>
        <tag>Definition 10</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">10</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Definition 10</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Definition 10</text></tag></title>
<!--  %**** String Line 550 **** -->      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">We say that a pair of vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y" text="list@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> in <Math mode="inline" tex="V{\setminus}\{0\}" text="V set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m2.1"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m2.1">0</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is <text font="bold">CS</text> (acronym for “Cauchy-Schwarz”), if</text></p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.5.9" xml:id="S1.E9">
          <tags>
            <tag>(1.9)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">1.9</tag>
          </tags>
          <Math mode="display" tex="b(x,y)^{2}{&lt;_{\nu}}q(x)q(y)." text="b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2 less _ nu q * x * q * y" xml:id="S1.E9.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.E9.m1.5"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.E9.m1.5">
                    <XMApp meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.E9.m1.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S1.E9.m1.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMWrap>
                            <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E9.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E9.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.E9.m1.3"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E9.m1.3">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.E9.m1.4"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.E9.m1.4">y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">We call <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m3.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m3.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> <text font="bold">weakly CS</text>, if</text></p>

            <XMath>

              </XMApp>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">(a condition already appearing in (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.5.5"/>)), and we call <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
<text font="bold">almost CS</text>, if</text></p>

        <p><text font="italic">for all <Math mode="inline" tex="c&gt;e" text="c &gt; e" xml:id="S1.Thmthm10.p1.m5">

                  </XMWrap>

              </XMath>
            </Math> <note mark="4" role="footnote" xml:id="footnote4"><tags>
                <tag><text font="upright">4</text></tag>
                <tag role="refnum"><text font="upright">4</text></tag>
                <tag role="typerefnum"><text font="upright">footnote 4</text></tag>
              </tags><text font="upright">In </text><cite class="ltx_citemacro_cite"><text font="upright">[</text><bibref bibrefs="IKR-LinAlg2" separator="," yyseparator=","/><text font="upright">, §5]</text></cite><text font="upright"> the terms “CS” and “weakly CS” have been used in a similar way for pairs of vectors with respect to a (not necessarily symmetric) bilinear form. </text></note></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" labels="LABEL:rem:II.5.11" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 11</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">11</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 11</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 11</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is almost CS. If <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is dense, then <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m3.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m3.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m3.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is weakly CS, whereas if <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is discrete, either <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m5.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m5.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m5.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is weakly CS, or <Math mode="inline" tex="b(x,y)^{2}{\cong_{\nu}}c_{0}q(x)q(y)" text="b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2 approximately-equals _ nu c _ 0 * q * x * q * y" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                    <XMTok font="upright" meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.1">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.2">y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">c</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.3">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.4"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm11.p1.m6.4">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S1.p20">
      <p>We save a relevant part of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.5.5"/> in the present more general situation.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm:II.5.12" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 12</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">12</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Theorem 12</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 12</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">If either <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is weakly CS, or <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m2.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m2.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m2.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m2.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is almost CS and both <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x)" text="q * x" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m3.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="q(y)" text="q * y" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m4.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m4.1">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are ghost, then <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m5.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m5.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m5.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.Thmthm12.p1.m5.2">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is quasilinear.</text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S1.p21">
        <p>If <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S1.p21.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m1.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p21.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p21.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> satisfies the assumptions of the theorem then so does <Math mode="inline" tex="({\lambda}x,\mu y)" text="open-interval@(lambda * x, mu * y)" xml:id="S1.p21.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m2.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m2.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p21.m2.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p21.m2.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for all <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda},\mu\in R{\setminus}\{0\}." text="list@(lambda, mu) element-of R set-minus set@(0)" xml:id="S1.p21.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m3.4"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S1.p21.m3.4">
                    <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m3.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m3.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p21.m3.2">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p21.m3.3">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set-minus" name="setminus" role="ADDOP">∖</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S1.p21.m3.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S1.p21.m3.1">0</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
Thus in view of Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.5.4"/> it suffices to prove that

            </XMath>
          </Math></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S1.p22">
        <p>Assume now that <Math mode="inline" tex="b(x,y)^{2}{\cong_{\nu}}q(x)q(y)" text="b * (open-interval@(x, y)) ^ 2 approximately-equals _ nu q * x * q * y" xml:id="S1.p22.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMApp>
                <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>

                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMDual>

                        <XMRef idref="S1.p22.m1.1"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S1.p22.m1.2">y</XMTok>
