    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S3.p5">
        <p>In Cases IB, IIB, IIIC the form <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S3.p5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math> is quasilinear an <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx+Ry," text="R * x + R * y" xml:id="S3.p5.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m2.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p5.m2.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> as observed in Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.5.5"/>, and hence</p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex5">
          <Math mode="display" tex="q({\lambda}x+\mu y)={\lambda}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}+\mu^{2}{\alpha}_{2}," text="q * (lambda * x + mu * y) = lambda ^ 2 * alpha _ 1 + mu ^ 2 * alpha _ 2" xml:id="S3.Ex5.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex5.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex5.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Ex5.m1.1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex5.m1.1.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>and the claims in (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.9"/>), (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.10"/>) are immediate. In the other cases we have <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}^{2}{&gt;_{\nu}}{\alpha}_{1}{\alpha}_{2}," text="alpha ^ 2 &gt; _ nu alpha _ 1 * alpha _ 2" xml:id="S3.p5.m3">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m3.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p5.m3.1">
                    <XMApp meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}{\cong_{\nu}}{\zeta}{\alpha}_{1}," text="alpha approximately-equals _ nu zeta * alpha _ 1" xml:id="S3.p5.m4">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p5.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p5.m4.1">
                    <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> and</p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex6">
          <Math mode="display" tex="q({\lambda}x+\mu y)={\lambda}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}+{\lambda}\mu{\alpha}+\mu^{2}{%&#10;\alpha}_{2}." text="q * (lambda * x + mu * y) = lambda ^ 2 * alpha _ 1 + lambda * mu * alpha + mu ^ 2 * alpha _ 2" xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.Ex6.m1.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1.1">
                    <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.Ex6.m1.1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Ex6.m1.1.1">
                            <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p>Now an easy inspection, which of the three terms on the right are <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S3.p5.m5">
            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
            </XMath>
          </Math>-dominant, gives us (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.7"/>) and (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.8"/>).
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
    <para xml:id="S3.p6">
      <p>It remains to handle the degenerate situation where at least one of the parameters <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}," text="alpha _ 1" xml:id="S3.p6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.p6.m1.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.p6.m1.1">
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{2}" text="alpha _ 2" xml:id="S3.p6.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}" text="alpha" xml:id="S3.p6.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is zero.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_convention" inlist="thm theorem:convention" labels="LABEL:conv:II.7.6" xml:id="S3.Thmthm5">
      <tags>
        <tag>Convention 5</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">5</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Convention 5</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Convention 5</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm5.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">We distinguish the following cases, also for later use.</text></p>
        <description xml:id="S3.I3">
          <item xml:id="S3.I3.ix4">
            <tags>
              <tag><text font="bold">Case IV: </text></tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item Case IV</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I3.ix4.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}\neq 0," text="alpha _ 1 not-equals 0" xml:id="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{2}=0" text="alpha _ 2 = 0" xml:id="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">, </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\neq 0." text="alpha not-equals 0" xml:id="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I3.ix4.p1.m3.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>

                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"></text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S3.I3.ix5">
            <tags>
              <tag><text font="bold">Case V: </text></tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item Case V</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I3.ix5.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}={\alpha}_{2}=0" text="alpha _ 1 = alpha _ 2 = 0" xml:id="S3.I3.ix5.p1.m1">

                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">, </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}\neq 0." text="alpha not-equals 0" xml:id="S3.I3.ix5.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I3.ix5.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I3.ix5.p1.m2.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> 
</text><!--  %**** String Line 900 **** --></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S3.I3.ix6">

            </para>
          </item>

            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I3.ix7.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}={\alpha}_{2}={\alpha}=0." text="alpha _ 1 = alpha _ 2 = alpha = 0" xml:id="S3.I3.ix7.p1.m1">

                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I3.ix7.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>

                          <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"></text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </description>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_notations" inlist="thm theorem:notations" labels="LABEL:notat:II.7.6" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6">
      <tags>
        <tag>Notations 6</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">6</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Notations 6</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Notations 6</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">In Case IV we choose <Math mode="inline" tex="{\zeta}\in{\mathcal{T}}" text="zeta element-of T" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}{\cong_{\nu}}{\zeta}{\alpha}_{1}." text="alpha approximately-equals _ nu zeta * alpha _ 1" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m2.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m2.1">
                      <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> In the subcase that both <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1},{\alpha}" text="list@(alpha _ 1, alpha)" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m3.2"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m3.1"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m3.2">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m3.1">α</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> are tangible we take <Math mode="inline" tex="{\zeta}={\alpha}{\alpha}_{1}^{-1}" text="zeta = alpha * (alpha _ 1) ^ (- 1)" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="minus" role="ADDOP">-</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and then have <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}={\zeta}{\alpha}_{1}." text="alpha = zeta * alpha _ 1" xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m5.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm6.p1.m5.1">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                      <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S3.p7">
      <p>Notice that the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S3.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p7.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p7.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is excessive in Cases IV, V, while <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S3.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasilinear on <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx+Ry" text="R * x + R * y" xml:id="S3.p7.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the other two cases.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p8">
      <p>Now the following is obvious.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_prop" inlist="thm theorem:prop" labels="LABEL:prop:II.7.7" xml:id="S3.Thmthm7">
      <tags>
        <tag>Proposition 7</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Proposition 7</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Proposition 7</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm7.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda},\mu\in R," text="list@(lambda, mu) element-of R" xml:id="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1.3">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1.1">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm7.p1.m1.2">μ</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
not both zero.</text></p>
      </para>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm7.p2">
        <enumerate xml:id="S3.I4">
          <item xml:id="S3.I4.i1">

                <Math mode="display" tex="q({\lambda}x+\mu y)=\left\{\begin{array}[]{lll}{\lambda}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}&amp;\text%&#10;{if}&amp;{\lambda}{&gt;_{\nu}}{\zeta}\mu,\\&#10;e{\lambda}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}=e{\lambda}\mu{\alpha}&amp;\text{if}&amp;{\lambda}{\cong_{%&#10;\nu}}{\zeta}\mu,\\&#10;{\lambda}\mu{\alpha}&amp;\text{if}&amp;{\lambda}{&lt;_{\nu}}{\zeta}\mu.\\&#10;\end{array}\right." text="q * (lambda * x + mu * y) = cases@(Array[[lambda ^ 2 * alpha _ 1, [if], lambda &gt; _ nu zeta * mu], [e * lambda ^ 2 * alpha _ 1 = e * lambda * mu * alpha, [if], lambda approximately-equals _ nu zeta * mu], [lambda * mu * alpha, [if], lambda less _ nu zeta * mu]])" xml:id="S3.E11.m1">

            </para>
            <para xml:id="S3.I4.i2.p2">

            <para xml:id="S3.I4.i3.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">In Case VI (</text><ref font="italic" labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.9"/><text font="italic">) holds if </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\xi}\in{\mathcal{T}}," text="xi element-of T" xml:id="S3.I4.i3.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I4.i3.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I4.i3.p1.m1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> and (</text><ref font="italic" labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.10"/><text font="italic">) holds if </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\xi}\notin{\mathcal{T}}" text="xi not-element-of T" xml:id="S3.I4.i3.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="not-element-of" name="notin" role="RELOP">∉</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="xi" role="UNKNOWN">ξ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> (as in Cases IB resp. IIB, IIIC).</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S3.I4.i4">
            <tags>
              <tag>(4)</tag>
              <tag role="refnum">4</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item 4</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I4.i4.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">In Case VII  </text><Math mode="inline" tex="q({\lambda}x+\mu y)=0." text="q * (lambda * x + mu * y) = 0" xml:id="S3.I4.i4.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I4.i4.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I4.i4.p1.m1.1">
                          <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S3.I4.i4.p1.m1.1.1"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMApp xml:id="S3.I4.i4.p1.m1.1.1">
                                  <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                  <XMApp>
                                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                                  </XMApp>
                                </XMApp>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"></text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_remark" inlist="thm theorem:remark" labels="LABEL:rmk:II.7.8" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8">
      <tags>
        <tag>Remark 8</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">8</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Remark 8</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Remark 8</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">The tables in Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.7.4"/> and <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.7.7"/> reveal that (for fixed <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y" text="list@(x, y)" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m1.1"/>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m1.2"/>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m1.2">y</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math>) the <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-value of <Math mode="inline" tex="q({\lambda}x+\mu y)" text="q * (lambda * x + mu * y)" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m3.1">
                        <XMTok font="upright" meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> only depends on the <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-values of <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}" text="lambda" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu" text="mu" xml:id="S3.Thmthm8.p1.m6">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>.
This is conceptually evident from the equation</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S3.Ex7">
          <Math mode="display" tex="eq({\lambda}x+\mu y)=q((e{\lambda})x+(e\mu)y)." text="e * q * (lambda * x + mu * y) = q * (e * lambda * x + e * mu * y)" xml:id="S3.Ex7.m1">

    <para xml:id="S3.p9">
      <p>We now use these tables to compute the CS-ratios of pairs of vectors in <Math mode="inline" tex="Rx+Ry" text="R * x + R * y" xml:id="S3.p9.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the case that the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S3.p9.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m2.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p9.m2.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m2.1">x</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p9.m2.2">y</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is free and excessive.</p>
    </para>

        <p><text font="italic">with <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}_{i},\mu_{i}\in R." text="list@(lambda _ i, mu _ i) element-of R" xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9.1">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9.1.1"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9.1.2"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9.1.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m9.1.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> We
exclude the (trivial) case that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}x^{\prime}={\mathcal{G}}y^{\prime}" text="G * x ^ prime = G * y ^ prime" xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m10">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="caligraphic upright" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and
assume without loss of generality that</text></p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.7.14" xml:id="S3.E14">
          <tags>
            <tag>(3.14)</tag>
            <tag role="refnum">3.14</tag>

              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">which for <Math mode="inline" tex="\mu_{1}\neq 0" text="mu _ 1 not-equals 0" xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m11">

            </Math> means that <Math mode="inline" tex="\big{[}\frac{{\lambda}_{1}}{\mu_{1}}\big{]}_{\nu}&gt;\big{[}\frac{{\lambda}_{2}}{%&#10;\mu_{2}}\big{]}_{\nu}" text="(delimited-[]@(lambda _ 1 / mu _ 1)) _ nu &gt; (delimited-[]@(lambda _ 2 / mu _ 2)) _ nu" xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m12">

                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. (Recall Definition <ref labelref="LABEL:defn:II.6.1"/>.)
Since the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,y)" text="open-interval@(x, y)" xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m13">

              </XMath>
            </Math> is free and excessive, the symmetric bilinear form <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="S3.Thmthm9.p1.m14">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>

    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_problem" inlist="thm theorem:problem" labels="LABEL:prob:II.7.9" xml:id="S3.Thmthm10">

        <enumerate xml:id="S3.I5">

            <para xml:id="S3.I5.ix23.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">Compute the CS-ratio </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="CS@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m1">

                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> and the </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}_{i},\mu_{j}," text="list@(lambda _ i, mu _ j)" xml:id="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m4.1"/>

                          </XMApp>

                            </XMApp>
                          </XMWrap>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> if both </text><Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime},y^{\prime}" text="list@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m5">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m5.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m5.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m5.1">
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S3.I5.ix23.p1.m5.2">

                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> are anisotropic.</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
          <item xml:id="S3.I5.ix24">
            <tags>
              <tag>b)</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item b)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S3.I5.ix24.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">Decide which pairs </text><Math mode="inline" tex="(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="open-interval@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I5.ix24.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.I5.ix24.p1.m1.1"/>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> are again excessive.</text></p>
            </para>
          </item>
        </enumerate>

    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S3.p10">

    <para xml:id="S3.p11">

        </Math> is excessive, we are in one of the Cases IA, IIA, IIIA, IIIB, IV, V, and in Case IIIB if at least one of the elements <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}," text="alpha _ 1" xml:id="S3.p12.m2">

    <para xml:id="S3.p13">

    <para xml:id="S3.p14">
      <p>Before entering systematic computations, we warm up with some observations. We have</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.7.17" xml:id="S3.E17">
        <tags>
          <tag>(3.17)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.17</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x,y)=\bigg{[}\frac{{\alpha}^{2}}{{\alpha}_{1}{\alpha}_{2}}%&#10;\bigg{]}=\bigg{[}\frac{{\zeta}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}^{2}}{{\zeta}\eta{\alpha}_{1}^{2%&#10;}}\bigg{]}=\bigg{[}\frac{\zeta}{\eta}\bigg{]}." text="CS@(x, y) = delimited-[]@(alpha ^ 2 / (alpha _ 1 * alpha _ 2)) = delimited-[]@((zeta ^ 2 * (alpha _ 1) ^ 2) / (zeta * eta * (alpha _ 1) ^ 2)) = delimited-[]@(zeta / eta)" xml:id="S3.E17.m1">

                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.E17.m1.5">
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>

                            </XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMApp>

    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p15">
      <p>We conclude that the pair <Math mode="inline" tex="(z,w)" text="open-interval@(z, w)" xml:id="S3.p15.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m1.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m1.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m1.1">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m1.2">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is excessive, except in Case IIIB. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="(z,w)" text="open-interval@(z, w)" xml:id="S3.p15.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m2.1"/>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m2.2"/>
              </XMApp>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m2.1">z</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m2.2">w</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasilinear, since both <Math mode="inline" tex="q(z)," text="q * z" xml:id="S3.p15.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m3.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.p15.m3.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m3.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m3.1">z</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="q(w)" text="q * w" xml:id="S3.p15.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S3.p15.m4.1"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m4.1">w</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are ghost. On the other hand</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.7.20" xml:id="S3.E20">
        <tags>
          <tag>(3.20)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">3.20</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x,z)=\bigg{[}\frac{{\alpha}^{2}}{{\alpha}_{1}\cdot{\zeta}^%&#10;{2}{\alpha}_{1}}\bigg{]}{\cong_{\nu}}1," text="CS@(x, z) = delimited-[]@(alpha ^ 2 / ((alpha _ 1 cdot zeta ^ 2) * alpha _ 1)) approximately-equals _ nu 1" xml:id="S3.E20.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S3.E20.m1.5"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S3.E20.m1.5">
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E20.m1.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E20.m1.2"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E20.m1.3"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S3.E20.m1.1">CS</XMTok>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E20.m1.2">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.E20.m1.3">z</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="delimited-[]"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.E20.m1.4"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">[</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.E20.m1.4">
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="divide" role="FRACOP"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok name="cdot" role="MULOP">⋅</XMTok>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                              <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMApp>

                              <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                              <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                            </XMApp>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok fontsize="210%" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">]</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>

      </equation>
      <p>Thus both pairs <Math mode="inline" tex="(x,z)," text="open-interval@(x, z)" xml:id="S3.p15.m5">
          <XMath>

                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.p15.m5.2">z</XMTok>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="(w,y)" text="open-interval@(w, y)" xml:id="S3.p15.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are quasilinear.</p>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S3.p16">

      <p>for all pairs <Math mode="inline" tex="(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="open-interval@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.p16.m1">

    <para xml:id="S3.p17">
      <p>We are ready to compute <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="CS@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.p17.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p17.m1.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>

                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S3.p17.m1.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMApp>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in all cases.</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S3.I6">
        <item xml:id="S3.I6.ix25">
          <tags>
            <tag>a)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item a)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1">
            <p>Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}_{2}{\geq_{\nu}}{\zeta}\mu_{2}" text="lambda _ 2 &gt;= _ nu zeta * mu _ 2" xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp meaning="greater-than-or-equals" role="RELOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                      <XMTok meaning="greater-than-or-equals" name="geq" role="RELOP">≥</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Now <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x^{\prime})\cong{\lambda}_{1}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}" text="q * x ^ prime approximately-equals (lambda _ 1) ^ 2 * alpha _ 1" xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m2.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m2.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>,
<Math mode="inline" tex="q(y^{\prime})\cong{\lambda}_{2}^{2}{\alpha}" text="q * y ^ prime approximately-equals (lambda _ 2) ^ 2 * alpha" xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m3.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m3.1">
                            <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math>, and hence</p>
            <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.7.23" xml:id="S3.E23">
              <tags>
                <tag>(3.23)</tag>
                <tag role="refnum">3.23</tag>
              </tags>
              <Math mode="display" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})=\bigg{[}\frac{{\lambda}_{1}^{2}\mu_%&#10;{2}^{2}{\alpha}^{2}}{{\lambda}_{1}^{2}{\alpha}_{1}{\lambda}_{2}^{2}{\alpha}}%&#10;\bigg{]}=\bigg{[}\frac{\mu_{2}^{2}{\zeta}^{2}}{{\lambda}_{2}^{2}}\bigg{]}{\leq%&#10;_{\nu}}1." text="CS@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime) = delimited-[]@(((lambda _ 1) ^ 2 * (mu _ 2) ^ 2 * alpha ^ 2) / ((lambda _ 1) ^ 2 * alpha _ 1 * (lambda _ 2) ^ 2 * alpha)) = delimited-[]@(((mu _ 2) ^ 2 * zeta ^ 2) / (lambda _ 2) ^ 2) less= _ nu 1" xml:id="S3.E23.m1">
                <XMath>

            <p>N.B. This is smaller than <Math mode="inline" tex="1^{\nu}" text="1 ^ nu" xml:id="S3.I6.ix25.p1.m4">

          <para xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1">
            <p>Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}_{1}{\leq_{\nu}}\eta\mu_{1}." text="lambda _ 1 less= _ nu eta * mu _ 1" xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m1.1"/>

                        <XMApp meaning="less-than-or-equals" role="RELOP">

                          <XMTok meaning="less-than-or-equals" name="leq" role="RELOP">≤</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> We obtain</p>

            <p>This can also be deduced from a) by interchanging <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y" text="list@(x, y)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m2">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m2.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m2.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m2.1">x</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m2.2">y</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime},y^{\prime}" text="list@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m3.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix26.p1.m3.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
        <item xml:id="S3.I6.ix27">
          <tags>
            <tag>c)</tag>

          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1">
            <p>Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}_{1}{\leq_{\nu}}{\zeta}\mu_{1}," text="lambda _ 1 less= _ nu zeta * mu _ 1" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m1">

Now <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x^{\prime})\cong{\lambda}_{1}\mu_{1}{\alpha}," text="q * x ^ prime approximately-equals lambda _ 1 * mu _ 1 * alpha" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m3">

            <equation labels="LABEL:eq:II.7.25" xml:id="S3.E25">
              <tags>
                <tag>(3.25)</tag>
                <tag role="refnum">3.25</tag>
              </tags>
              <Math mode="display" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})=\bigg{[}\frac{{\lambda}_{1}^{2}\mu_%&#10;{2}^{2}{\alpha}^{2}}{{\lambda}_{1}{\lambda}_{2}\mu_{1}\mu_{2}{\alpha}^{2}}%&#10;\bigg{]}=\bigg{[}\frac{{\lambda}_{1}\mu_{2}}{\mu_{1}{\lambda}_{2}}\bigg{]}{&gt;_{%&#10;\nu}}1." text="CS@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime) = delimited-[]@(((lambda _ 1) ^ 2 * (mu _ 2) ^ 2 * alpha ^ 2) / (lambda _ 1 * lambda _ 2 * mu _ 1 * mu _ 2 * alpha ^ 2)) = delimited-[]@((lambda _ 1 * mu _ 2) / (mu _ 1 * lambda _ 2)) &gt; _ nu 1" xml:id="S3.E25.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.E25.m1.4"/>

            </equation>
            <p>Thus <Math mode="inline" tex="(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="open-interval@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m5">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m5.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m5.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m5.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m5.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is excessive except in Case IIIB. Then there exist no <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m6">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-values in <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> strictly between <Math mode="inline" tex="{\zeta}" text="zeta" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="\eta" text="eta" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>. Hence <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{CS}}(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})={\operatorname{CS}}(z,w)," text="CS@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime) = CS@(z, w)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.5"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.5">
                        <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.5.1"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.5.2"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.1">CS</XMTok>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.5.1">
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.5.2">
                                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                                <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                              </XMApp>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                        <XMDual>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.2"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.3"/>
                            <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.4"/>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="OPFUNCTION" scriptpos="post" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.2">CS</XMTok>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.3">z</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m10.4">w</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMDual>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and we know from the above that <Math mode="inline" tex="(x^{\prime},y^{\prime})" text="open-interval@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m11.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m11.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m11.1">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S3.I6.ix27.p1.m11.2">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is quasilinear.</p>
          </para>
        </item>

            <p>Again we can also deduce e) from d) by interchanging <Math mode="inline" tex="x,y" text="list@(x, y)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix29.p1.m3">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>

                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S3.I6.ix29.p1.m3.2">y</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="x^{\prime},y^{\prime}" text="list@(x ^ prime, y ^ prime)" xml:id="S3.I6.ix29.p1.m4">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>

                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" name="prime" role="SUPOP">′</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>

              </Math>.</p>
