                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>. Then <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S6.Thmthm8.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S6.Thmthm8.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-minimal and <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="S6.Thmthm8.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-anisotropic iff <Math mode="inline" tex="{\beta},x_{1},x_{2}" text="list@(beta, x _ 1, x _ 2)" xml:id="S6.Thmthm8.p1.m6">

            </Math> are tangible and
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}^{2}x_{1}^{2}+{\alpha}_{2}^{2}x_{2}^{2}&lt;_{\nu}{\beta}x_{1}x_{2}." text="(alpha _ 1) ^ 2 * (x _ 1) ^ 2 + (alpha _ 2) ^ 2 * (x _ 2) ^ 2 less _ nu beta * x _ 1 * x _ 2" xml:id="S6.Thmthm8.p1.m7">

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math></text></p>
      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S6.p18">
      <p>Returning to the tables of <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S6.p18.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-values in §<ref labelref="LABEL:sec:II.7"/> it is of interest to ask which of the vectors
<Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}{\varepsilon}_{1}+\mu{\varepsilon}_{2}" text="lambda * varepsilon _ 1 + mu * varepsilon _ 2" xml:id="S6.p18.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> there are <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S6.p18.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal. We only consider the case that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}^{2}&gt;_{\nu}{\alpha}_{1}{\alpha}_{2}" text="alpha ^ 2 &gt; _ nu alpha _ 1 * alpha _ 2" xml:id="S6.p18.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMApp meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">
                <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok meaning="greater-than" role="RELOP">&gt;</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> in the notations used there, since otherwise <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S6.p18.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is quasilinear and the matter is settled by Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.9.6"/>.b.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm:II.9.9" xml:id="S6.Thmthm9">
      <tags>
        <tag>Theorem 9</tag>

      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Theorem 9</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S6.Thmthm9.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S6.Thmthm9.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a nontrivial tangible supersemifield, and <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S6.Thmthm9.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is a quadratic form on the free binary <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S6.Thmthm9.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-module
<Math mode="inline" tex="V=R{\varepsilon}_{1}+R{\varepsilon}_{2}." text="V = R * varepsilon _ 1 + R * varepsilon _ 2" xml:id="S6.Thmthm9.p1.m4">

                <XMDual>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                            <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>

                          </XMApp>

                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                </XMDual>

              </XMath>

              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>, and assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}{\alpha}_{2}&lt;_{\nu}{\alpha}^{2}" text="alpha _ 1 * alpha _ 2 less _ nu alpha ^ 2" xml:id="S6.Thmthm9.p1.m7">

            </Math> with

              </XMath>
            </Math> We use Notations

        <enumerate xml:id="S6.I6">
          <item xml:id="S6.I6.ix52">
            <tags>
              <tag>i)</tag>
              <tag role="typerefnum">item i)</tag>
            </tags>
            <para xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1">
              <p><text font="italic">If </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1}\neq 0," text="alpha _ 1 not-equals 0" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m1.1">

                          <XMApp>

                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>

                        </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{2}\neq 0" text="alpha _ 2 not-equals 0" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="0" role="NUMBER">0</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">, then </text><Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m3">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is </text><Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m4">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">-minimal iff either </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}\cong_{\nu}\zeta\mu" text="lambda approximately-equals _ nu zeta * mu" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m5">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> and
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{1},{\lambda}\in{\mathcal{T}}" text="list@(alpha _ 1, lambda) element-of T" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m6">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m6.2"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m6.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m6.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m6.1">λ</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">, or </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda}\cong_{\nu}\eta\mu" text="lambda approximately-equals _ nu eta * mu" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m7">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> and </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha}_{2},\mu\in{\mathcal{T}}" text="list@(alpha _ 2, mu) element-of T" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m8">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m8.2"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m8.1"/>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m8.2">
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m8.1">μ</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                      <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">T</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic">, or
</text><Math mode="inline" tex="\eta\mu&lt;_{\nu}{\lambda}&lt;_{\nu}\zeta\mu" text="eta * mu less _ nu lambda less _ nu zeta * mu" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m9">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="eta" role="UNKNOWN">η</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN">λ</XMTok>
                      <XMApp meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post4"/>
                        <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="zeta" role="UNKNOWN">ζ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> and at most one of the three elements </text><Math mode="inline" tex="{\alpha},{\lambda},\mu" text="list@(alpha, lambda, mu)" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10.2"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10.3"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10.1">α</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10.2">λ</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.I6.ix52.p1.m10.3">μ</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> is ghost</text></p>
            </para>

    </theorem>
    <proof>
      <title class="ltx_runin" font="italic">Proof.</title>
      <para xml:id="S6.p19">
        <p>Browse through tables (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.7"/>), (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.8"/>), (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.11"/>), (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:II.7.12"/>) and apply Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.9.7"/>, reading <Math mode="inline" tex="{\lambda},\mu,{\alpha}" text="list@(lambda, mu, alpha)" xml:id="S6.p19.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p19.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p19.m1.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p19.m1.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="lambda" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p19.m1.1">λ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="mu" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p19.m1.2">μ</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p19.m1.3">α</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math> for <Math mode="inline" tex="x_{1},x_{2},{\beta}" text="list@(x _ 1, x _ 2, beta)" xml:id="S6.p19.m2">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p19.m2.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p19.m2.3"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S6.p19.m2.1"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p19.m2.2">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S6.p19.m2.3">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S6.p19.m2.1">β</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>.
∎</p>
      </para>
    </proof>
  </section>
  <section inlist="toc" labels="LABEL:sec:7" xml:id="S7">
    <tags>
      <tag>7</tag>
      <tag role="refnum">7</tag>
      <tag role="typerefnum">§7</tag>
    </tags>
    <title><tag close=". ">7</tag><Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.m1">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>-minimal vectors with big support</title>
    <toctitle><tag close=" ">7</tag><Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.m2">
        <XMath>
          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
        </XMath>
      </Math>-minimal vectors with big support</toctitle>
    <para xml:id="S7.p1">
      <p>Again we assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S7.p1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a tangible supertropical semiring, <Math mode="inline" tex="{\mathcal{G}}" text="G" xml:id="S7.p1.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="caligraphic" role="UNKNOWN">G</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a cancellative monoid, <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S7.p1.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
a free <Math mode="inline" tex="R" text="R" xml:id="S7.p1.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-module with base <Math mode="inline" tex="({\varepsilon}_{i}{\ {|}\ }i\in I)" text="conditional@(varepsilon _ i, i) element-of I" xml:id="S7.p1.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p1.m5.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p1.m5.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="conditional" role="MODIFIEROP" rpadding="5.0pt" stretchy="false">|</XMTok>
                    <XMApp rpadding="5.0pt">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                      <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and <Math mode="inline" tex="q:V\to R" text="q colon V to R" xml:id="S7.p1.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok name="colon" role="METARELOP">:</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              <XMApp>
                <XMTok name="to" role="ARROW">→</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">R</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a quadratic form. For later use, we adopt the following
notation.</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_notation" inlist="thm theorem:notation" labels="LABEL:notation:7.1" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1">
      <tags>
        <tag>Notation 1</tag>
        <tag role="refnum">1</tag>
        <tag role="typerefnum">Notation 1</tag>
      </tags>
      <title class="ltx_runin"><tag><text font="bold">Notation 1</text></tag></title>
      <para xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Let <Math mode="inline" tex="x=\sum\limits_{i\in I}x_{i}{\varepsilon}_{i}\in V" text="x = (sum _ (i element-of I))@(x _ i * varepsilon _ i) element-of V" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                      <XMTok font="upright" mathstyle="text" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="upright" fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                        <XMTok name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                        <XMTok fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and <Math mode="inline" tex="J" text="J" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> a subset of <Math mode="inline" tex="I." text="I" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m3.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m3.1">I</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="upright" role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> We put</text></p>
        <equation xml:id="S7.Ex1">
          <Math mode="display" tex="x(J):=\sum_{i\in J}x_{i}{\varepsilon}_{i}." text="x * J assign (sum _ (i element-of J))@(x _ i * varepsilon _ i)" xml:id="S7.Ex1.m1">
            <XMath>
              <XMDual>
                <XMRef idref="S7.Ex1.m1.2"/>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex1.m1.2">
                    <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.Ex1.m1.1"/>
                        <XMWrap>
                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Ex1.m1.1">J</XMTok>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid3"/>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="varepsilon" role="UNKNOWN">ε</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMath>
          </Math>
        </equation>
        <p><text font="italic">If <Math mode="inline" tex="J=\{i\}" text="J = set@(i)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>

                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="J=\{i,j\}," text="J = set@(i, j)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m5.3"/>
                  <XMWrap>
                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m5.3">
                      <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

                          <XMTok meaning="set"/>

              </XMath>
            </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="i\neq j," text="i not-equals j" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m6">

                    </XMApp>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> we
write for short <Math mode="inline" tex="x(i)" text="x * i" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m7">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m7.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="x(i,j)" text="x * open-interval@(i, j)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m8">

              </XMath>
            </Math> instead of <Math mode="inline" tex="x(\{i\})" text="x * set@(i)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm1.p1.m9">

      </para>
    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S7.p2">
      <p>Assume now that <Math mode="inline" tex="I=\{1,\dots,n\}" text="I = set@(1, dots, n)" xml:id="S7.p2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m1.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m1.2"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m1.3"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>
                  <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.p2.m1.1">1</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S7.p2.m1.2">…</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p2.m1.3">n</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> with <Math mode="inline" tex="n=3" text="n = 3" xml:id="S7.p2.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="3" role="NUMBER">3</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or <Math mode="inline" tex="n=4" text="n = 4" xml:id="S7.p2.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
              <XMTok meaning="4" role="NUMBER">4</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, and that
<Math mode="inline" tex="x\in V" text="x element-of V" xml:id="S7.p2.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is a vector of full support,</p>
      <equation xml:id="S7.Ex2">
        <Math mode="display" tex="x=\sum_{i=1}^{n}x_{i}{\varepsilon}_{i},\quad\text{all}\quad x_{i}\neq 0." text="formulae@(x = list@(((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(x _ i * varepsilon _ i), [all]), x _ i not-equals 0)" xml:id="S7.Ex2.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.Ex2.m1.2"/>
              <XMWrap>

                      <XMDual>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="list"/>

                                <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                                <XMApp>
                                  <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                                  <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>

                            </XMApp>

                      </XMDual>

                    <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex2.m1.2.2">
                      <XMTok meaning="not-equals" name="neq" role="RELOP">≠</XMTok>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>

      </equation>
      <p>We choose a companion <Math mode="inline" tex="b" text="b" xml:id="S7.p2.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="q," text="q" xml:id="S7.p2.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m6.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p2.m6.1">q</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> and then have a presentation</p>
      <equation labels="LABEL:eq:7.1" xml:id="S7.E1">
        <tags>
          <tag>(7.1)</tag>
          <tag role="refnum">7.1</tag>
        </tags>
        <Math mode="display" tex="q(x)=\sum_{i=1}^{n}{\alpha}_{i}x_{i}^{2}+\sum_{i&lt;j}{\beta}_{ij}x_{i}x_{j}." text="q * x = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(alpha _ i * (x _ i) ^ 2) + (sum _ (i less j))@(beta _ (i * j) * x _ i * x _ j)" xml:id="S7.E1.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.E1.m1.2"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.E1.m1.2">
                  <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.E1.m1.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.E1.m1.1">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="plus" role="ADDOP">+</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                          <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="1" role="NUMBER">1</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">n</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" name="alpha" role="UNKNOWN">α</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUPERSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMApp scriptpos="mid">
                        <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="mid2"/>
                        <XMTok mathstyle="display" meaning="sum" role="SUMOP" scriptpos="mid">∑</XMTok>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok fontsize="70%" meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                          <XMApp>
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                          </XMApp>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
      <p>We ask, under which conditions is <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S7.p2.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.p2.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal, and then search
for possibilities to write <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S7.p2.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math> as the supremum <Math mode="inline" tex="y\vee z" text="y or z" xml:id="S7.p2.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="or" name="vee" role="ADDOP">∨</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">y</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of two
<Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.p2.m11">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="y,z\in V" text="list@(y, z) element-of V" xml:id="S7.p2.m12">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="element-of" name="in" role="RELOP">∈</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="list"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m12.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p2.m12.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p2.m12.1">y</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p2.m12.2">z</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of small support, i.e., <Math mode="inline" tex="|{\operatorname{supp}}(y)|\leq 2," text="absolute-value@(supp@(y)) less= 2" xml:id="S7.p2.m13">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m8.3">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m8.2"/>
                              <XMWrap>
                                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m8.2">J</XMTok>
                                <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>
                          </XMApp>
                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for some <Math mode="inline" tex="J\varsubsetneqq I." text="J * [\varsubsetneqq] * I" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m9">
                <XMath>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m9.1"/>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMApp xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m9.1">
                        <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">J</XMTok>
                        <ERROR class="undefined">\varsubsetneqq</ERROR>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> We have</p>
            <equation xml:id="S7.Ex3">
              <Math mode="display" tex="x=x(i)\vee x(j,k)," text="x = x * i or x * open-interval@(j, k)" xml:id="S7.Ex3.m1">

            <p>It follows that</p>
            <equation xml:id="S7.Ex5">
              <Math mode="display" tex="{\alpha}_{j}x_{j}^{2}+{\alpha}_{k}x_{k}^{2}&lt;_{\nu}{\beta}_{jk}x_{j}x_{k}," text="alpha _ j * (x _ j) ^ 2 + alpha _ k * (x _ k) ^ 2 less _ nu beta _ (j * k) * x _ j * x _ k" xml:id="S7.Ex5.m1">

            <p>and we read off from Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:II.9.7"/> that
<Math mode="inline" tex="x(j,k)" text="x * open-interval@(j, k)" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m11">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMApp>
                        <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m11.1"/>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m11.2"/>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m11.1">j</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m11.2">k</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m12">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-minimal. By Proposition <ref labelref="LABEL:prop:II.9.6"/>.a also <Math mode="inline" tex="x(i)" text="x * i" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m13">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m13.1"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m13.1">i</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> is
<Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.I1.ix55.p1.m14">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-minimal.</p>
          </para>
        </item>
      </enumerate>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S7.p6">
      <p>Note furthermore that</p>
      <equation xml:id="S7.Ex6">
        <Math mode="display" tex="b(x(i),x(j,k))&lt;_{\nu}q(x(i))\cong_{\nu}q(x)." text="b * open-interval@(x * i, x * open-interval@(j, k)) less _ nu q * x * i approximately-equals _ nu q * x" xml:id="S7.Ex6.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.Ex6.m1.6"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex6.m1.6">
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                      <XMApp>

                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Ex6.m1.1"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex6.m1.6.2">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                              <XMRef idref="S7.Ex6.m1.3"/>
                            </XMApp>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">&lt;</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Ex6.m1.6.3"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex6.m1.6.3">
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Ex6.m1.4"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp meaning="approximately-equals" role="RELOP">
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok meaning="approximately-equals" name="cong" role="RELOP">≅</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                    <XMDual>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Ex6.m1.5"/>
                      <XMWrap>
                        <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                        <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Ex6.m1.5">x</XMTok>
                        <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
      </equation>
    </para>
    <para xml:id="S7.p7">
      <p>Assume now that all <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S7.p7.m1">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-dominant terms in the sum (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:7.1"/>)
are of the form <Math mode="inline" tex="{\beta}_{ij}x_{i}x_{j}." text="beta _ (i * j) * x _ i * x _ j" xml:id="S7.p7.m2">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p7.m2.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p7.m2.1">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" name="beta" role="UNKNOWN">β</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">i</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post2"/>
                    <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                    <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" role="UNKNOWN">j</XMTok>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> We distinguish two subcases.</p>
      <enumerate xml:id="S7.I2">
        <item xml:id="S7.I2.ix56">
          <tags>
            <tag>B)</tag>
            <tag role="typerefnum">item B)</tag>
          </tags>
          <para xml:id="S7.I2.ix56.p1">
            <p>Exactly two of the terms <Math mode="inline" tex="{\beta}_{ij}x_{i}x_{j}" text="beta _ (i * j) * x _ i * x _ j" xml:id="S7.I2.ix56.p1.m1">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                    <XMApp>

                      <XMApp>

                </XMath>
              </Math> are
<Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S7.I2.ix56.p1.m2">

                  <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                </XMath>
              </Math>-dominant.</p>
          </para>
        </item>

    <para xml:id="S7.p9">
      <p>In both cases <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x)&gt;_{\gamma}{\alpha}_{i}x_{i}^{2}" text="q * x &gt; _ gamma alpha _ i * (x _ i) ^ 2" xml:id="S7.p9.m1">

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> for all <Math mode="inline" tex="i\in I." text="i element-of I" xml:id="S7.p9.m2">
          <XMath>

          </XMath>
        </Math> It
follows by Corollary <ref labelref="LABEL:cor:II.9.8"/> that in Case B both vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x(i,j)" text="x * open-interval@(i, j)" xml:id="S7.p9.m3">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m3.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m3.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p9.m3.1">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p9.m3.2">j</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>
and <Math mode="inline" tex="x(i,k)" text="x * open-interval@(i, k)" xml:id="S7.p9.m4">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m4.1"/>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m4.2"/>
                </XMApp>
                <XMWrap>
                  <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p9.m4.1">i</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p9.m4.2">k</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> are <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="S7.p9.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-anisotropic and <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.p9.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal, while in Case C
all three vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="x(1,2)," text="x * open-interval@(1, 2)" xml:id="S7.p9.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m7.3"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMApp xml:id="S7.p9.m7.3">
                  <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m7.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.p9.m7.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="1" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.p9.m7.1">1</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok meaning="2" role="NUMBER" xml:id="S7.p9.m7.2">2</XMTok>
                      <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
                <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> <Math mode="inline" tex="x(1,3)" text="x * open-interval@(1, 3)" xml:id="S7.p9.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="x(2,3)" text="x * open-interval@(2, 3)" xml:id="S7.p9.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              <XMDual>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="open-interval"/>

                  <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> have these
properties. Due to our knowledge of all <Math mode="inline" tex="\nu" text="nu" xml:id="S7.p9.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-dominant terms in
the sum (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:7.1"/>), we see that in Case B</p>

      <p>while in Case C for every 2-element
subset <Math mode="inline" tex="\{r,s\}" text="set@(r, s)" xml:id="S7.p9.m11">

      <equation xml:id="S7.Ex8">
        <Math mode="display" tex="b(x(r),x(s))\cong_{\nu}q(x(r,s))\cong_{\nu}q(x)." text="b * open-interval@(x * r, x * s) approximately-equals _ nu q * x * open-interval@(r, s) approximately-equals _ nu q * x" xml:id="S7.Ex8.m1">

                        <XMApp xml:id="S7.Ex8.m1.6.2">

          <para xml:id="S7.I3.ix58.p2">
            <p>Arguing as above we conclude easily that there is a partition

                          <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                          <XMTok font="italic" fontsize="70%" name="nu" role="UNKNOWN">ν</XMTok>
                        </XMApp>
                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                          <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                          <XMDual>
                            <XMRef idref="S7.Ex9.m1.3"/>
                            <XMWrap>
                              <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Ex9.m1.3">x</XMTok>
                              <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>
                            </XMWrap>
                          </XMDual>
                        </XMApp>
                      </XMApp>
                      <XMTok role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math>
            </equation>
            <p>while <Math mode="inline" tex="q(x(S))&lt;_{\nu}q(x)" text="q * x * S less _ nu q * x" xml:id="S7.I3.ix58.p2.m7">
                <XMath>
                  <XMApp>
                    <XMApp meaning="less-than" role="RELOP">
                      <XMTok role="SUBSCRIPTOP" scriptpos="post3"/>

                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>

                          <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>
                          <XMApp xml:id="S7.I3.ix58.p2.m7.3">
                            <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                            <XMDual>

                              </XMWrap>
                            </XMDual>

                          <XMTok role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">)</XMTok>

                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I3.ix58.p2.m7.2"/>
                        <XMWrap>

                        </XMWrap>
                      </XMDual>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMApp>
                </XMath>
              </Math> for all other subsets <Math mode="inline" tex="S" text="S" xml:id="S7.I3.ix58.p2.m8">
                <XMath>
                  <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">S</XMTok>

                </XMath>
              </Math> with

                  </XMDual>
                </XMath>
              </Math> Also for any two different subsets <Math mode="inline" tex="S,T" text="list@(S, T)" xml:id="S7.I3.ix58.p2.m11">

    <para xml:id="S7.p11">
      <p>Summarizing the essentials of this study, we obtain</p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm:7.2" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2">

      <para xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m1">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m2">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-minimal and <Math mode="inline" tex="{\operatorname{supp}}(x)=I=\{1,\dots,n\}" text="supp@(x) = I = set@(1, dots, n)" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3">
              <XMath>
                <XMApp>
                  <XMTok meaning="multirelation"/>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3.1"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3.2"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMApp>

                      <XMWrap>

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMApp>
                  </XMDual>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
                  <XMTok font="upright" meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>
                  <XMDual>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="set"/>
                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3.3"/>

                      <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3.5"/>
                    </XMApp>
                    <XMWrap>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="OPEN" stretchy="false">{</XMTok>

                      <XMTok font="upright" role="PUNCT">,</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" name="dots" role="ID" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3.4">…</XMTok>

                      <XMTok role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m3.5">n</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="upright" role="CLOSE" stretchy="false">}</XMTok>
                    </XMWrap>
                  </XMDual>
                </XMApp>
              </XMath>
            </Math>
with <Math mode="inline" tex="n\geq 3." text="n &gt;= 3" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m4">
              <XMath>
                <XMDual>
                  <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m4.1"/>
                  <XMWrap>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> Then <Math mode="inline" tex="x" text="x" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math> is <Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p1.m6">

                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-isotropic and exactly one of the
following four cases holds:

      </para>
      <para xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p2">
        <enumerate xml:id="S7.I4">
          <item xml:id="S7.I4.ix59">
            <tags>

            <para xml:id="S7.I4.ix59.p1">
              <p><Math mode="inline" tex="n=3." text="n = 3" xml:id="S7.I4.ix59.p1.m1">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMDual>

                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> There is a unique partition </text><Math mode="inline" tex="I=J\dot{\cup}K" text="I = J * dot@(union) * K" xml:id="S7.I4.ix59.p1.m2">
                  <XMath>

                      </XMApp>

                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> with

                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> both </text><Math mode="inline" tex="x(J)," text="x * J" xml:id="S7.I4.ix59.p1.m5">

                      </XMWrap>
                    </XMDual>
                  </XMath>
                </Math><text font="italic"> </text><Math mode="inline" tex="x(K)" text="x * K" xml:id="S7.I4.ix59.p1.m6">
                  <XMath>
                    <XMApp>
                      <XMTok meaning="times" role="MULOP">⁢</XMTok>
                      <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">x</XMTok>
                      <XMDual>
                        <XMRef idref="S7.I4.ix59.p1.m6.1"/>

        <p><text font="italic">In Case C, (<ref labelref="LABEL:eq:7.5"/>) holds for any two different <Math mode="inline" tex="2" text="2" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p3.m5">
              <XMath>
                <XMTok font="upright" meaning="2" role="NUMBER">2</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-element

                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> of <Math mode="inline" tex="I," text="I" xml:id="S7.Thmthm2.p3.m7">

                <XMDual>

                  </XMWrap>
                </XMDual>
              </XMath>
            </Math> and moreover</text></p>
        <equation labels="LABEL:eq:7.7" xml:id="S7.E7">
          <tags>
            <tag>(7.7)</tag>

          </tags>

            <XMath>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">b</XMTok>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok role="OPEN" stretchy="false">(</XMTok>

              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>

          </Math>
        </equation>

    </theorem>
    <para xml:id="S7.p12">
      <p>As before we assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="V" text="V" xml:id="S7.p12.m1">
          <XMath>

          </XMath>
        </Math> is free with base

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math>, <Math mode="inline" tex="n=3" text="n = 3" xml:id="S7.p12.m4">

            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="equals" role="RELOP">=</XMTok>

            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> or 4. Given two
<Math mode="inline" tex="g" text="g" xml:id="S7.p12.m5">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">g</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-anisotropic <Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.p12.m6">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal vectors <Math mode="inline" tex="y,z\in V" text="list@(y, z) element-of V" xml:id="S7.p12.m7">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>

                </XMWrap>
              </XMDual>
              <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">V</XMTok>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> of small support,
we now ask for conditions under which the vector <Math mode="inline" tex="x:=y\vee z" text="x assign y or z" xml:id="S7.p12.m8">
          <XMath>
            <XMApp>
              <XMTok meaning="assign" role="RELOP">:=</XMTok>

                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">z</XMTok>
              </XMApp>
            </XMApp>
          </XMath>
        </Math> is
<Math mode="inline" tex="q" text="q" xml:id="S7.p12.m9">
          <XMath>
            <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
          </XMath>
        </Math>-minimal and has full support <Math mode="inline" tex="I." text="I" xml:id="S7.p12.m10">
          <XMath>
            <XMDual>
              <XMRef idref="S7.p12.m10.1"/>
              <XMWrap>
                <XMTok font="italic" role="UNKNOWN" xml:id="S7.p12.m10.1">I</XMTok>
                <XMTok role="PERIOD">.</XMTok>
              </XMWrap>
            </XMDual>
          </XMath>
        </Math> In view of Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:7.2"/>,
we will be content to assume from the beginning that</p>

    <para xml:id="S7.p13">
      <p>A satisfactory converse to Theorem <ref labelref="LABEL:thm:7.2"/> in the cases A) and B)
runs as follows.
<!--  %**** String Line 1775 **** --></p>
    </para>
    <theorem class="ltx_theorem_thm" inlist="thm theorem:thm" labels="LABEL:thm:7.3" xml:id="S7.Thmthm3">
      <tags>

      <para xml:id="S7.Thmthm3.p1">
        <p><text font="italic">Assume that <Math mode="inline" tex="y,z\in V" text="list@(y, z) element-of V" xml:id="S7.Thmthm3.p1.m1">

                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">q</XMTok>
              </XMath>
            </Math>-minimal,

              <XMath>

                <XMTok role="UNKNOWN">I</XMTok>
              </XMath>

            <XMath>

        <p><text font="italic">Assume finally that <Math mode="inline" tex="n=3," text="n = 3" xml:id="S7.Thmthm3.p1.m6">

                              <XMWrap>

                  </XMWrap>

              </XMath>

                        <XMApp>
                          <XMTok meaning="absolute-value"/>
                          <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm3.p1.m8.3.1"/>

                          <XMDual xml:id="S7.Thmthm3.p1.m8.3.1">
                            <XMApp>
                              <XMRef idref="S7.Thmthm3.p1.m8.1"/>
